to test do a clean on org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui and introduce some sort of compile error in the code to compile

The consolePatternMatcher with id org.eclipse.ant.ui.eclipseJavacPatternMatcher is matching on expression with the following pattern:

     \[javac.*\].*(ERROR|WARNING) in.*

The match is returning a match for "C:\eclipse-dev\test-bench3.3\org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui\test support\org\eclipse\ant\tests\ui\support\inputHandlers\TestSWTInputHandler.java (at line 1)"

NOTE the "(at line 1)" at the end. This is used to create a path to a file, which, of course does not exist. Not sure if javac has changed to add this to the error message? The pattern matcher does not seem to look for this.
*** Bug 168497 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The problem occured when using the jdt compiler adaptor for javac.
The format of the error messages changed from:
      [javac] 1. ERROR in core/ant/InternalAntRunner.java
      [javac]  (at line 66)

to:
      [javac] 1. ERROR in core/ant/InternalAntRunner.java (at line 66)

Fixed in the AbstractJavacPatternMatcher and its subclasses.

traces.message: Unable to open external editor for C:/darins/workspaces/1029/org.eclipse.ant.tests.ui/test support/org/eclipse/ant/tests/ui/support/inputHandlers/TestSWTInputHandler.java (at line 1).
